snippet: The Fed turns over most of its profits from a bond-buying campaign to the Treasury Department, helping people buy cars and refinance mortgages. But the earnings are set to decrease.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports that it transferred record-breaking estimated $98.7 billion in profits from its bond-buying campaign to Treasury Dept in 2014, which it is required to do by law, bringing total over past five years to $421 billion; program helped reduce growth of federal debt and has been boon to taxpayers, but Fed plans to increase benchmark interest rates, which will reduce its profits.
lead_paragraph: The Fed turns over most of its profits from a bond-buying campaign to the Treasury Department, helping people buy cars and refinance mortgages. But the earnings are set to decrease.

headline.main: Windfall for Taxpayers Coming to an End
headline.print_headline: End Coming to Windfall for Taxpayers
